prompt: What words are used for remembering Allah (dhikr: SubhānAllāh, Alhamdulillāh, Allāhu Akbar)?
response:
Arabic: سبحان الله، الحمد لله، الله أكبر.

Transliteration: SubḥānAllāh, al-ḥamdu lillāh, Allāhu akbar.

English: Glory be to Allah, praise be to Allah, Allah is the Greatest.

prompt: List the three surahs to recite in the evening.
response:
Arabic: قُلْ هُوَ اللَّهُ أَحَدٌ، قُلْ أَعُوذُ بِرَبِّ الْفَلَقِ، قُلْ أَعُوذُ بِرَبِّ النَّاسِ.

Transliteration: Qul huwa Allāhu aḥad, Qul aʿūdhu birabbil-falaq, Qul aʿūdhu birabbin-nās.

English: Surah al-Ikhlās, Surah al-Falaq, and Surah an-Nās.

prompt: What dua is said when leaving the house?
response:
Arabic: بسم الله، توكلت على الله، ولا حول ولا قوة إلا بالله.

Transliteration: Bismillāh, tawakkaltu ʿalallāh, wa lā ḥawla wa lā quwwata illā billāh.

English: In the name of Allah, I place my trust in Allah, and there is no power nor might except with Allah.
